Content:
Hi guys,
I've got a suggestion for a general structure for KMDLabs somewhat related to the `multisig discussion`.
Please read the disclaimer.
The intention of the proposal is to get everyone interested involved and to check that job off the todo list.
Everything on it is a `suggestion`.  Please change it as you see fit (add your name, strikethrough, add your changes)!
https://kmdlabs.cc/p/KMDLabs_operations_proposal

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
-----------
Please see `https://kmdlabs.cc/p/KMDLabs_operations_proposal` for context.
-----------``` If the bureaucracy grows too large the Group Consensus can cull it as needed.```
Basically this mechanism would allow people to get on with Dev work and using LABs.
The elected volunteers would be given the responsibility for day-to-day matters to make this possible.
The way things would work aren't all that different than now.  For example, asking opinions on how to multisig or what logo looks better. 
The only real changes I see from now are that Labs Elected Volunteer(LEV)s would have some ability to take action through the limited trust granted to them through election by Stakers.  The LEV could then make a decision based on what they have learned.
LEVs serve the Group Consensus, and if their actions vary too widely from that path, then Group Consensus has the power to bring things back into line.
At the moment we are still setting things up and most Dev work is focussed on Labs.  That will change and people, including LEVs, will be focussed on `using` the Labs platform.
I think the LEV jobs will loose their glamour fairly quickly when it is realized how much work will be required, while others are out there having fun.  This is the nature of volunteer work.

Author: newvulcan#9571
Content:
Hi, I'm having some problems with finding ZEX blocks on my mining pool. All other coins are working fine including KMD, ARRR, ZCL and HUSH. I'm using S-NOMP with the following config file for ZEX:{
"name": "ZADDEX",
"symbol": "ZEX",
"algorithm": "equihash",
"sapling": true,
"requireShielding": true
}
My komodod command line is: ./komodod -ac_founders=1 -addnode=5.9.102.210 -ac_name=ZEX -ac_reward=13000000000 -ac_pubkey=039d4a50cc70d1184e462a22edb3b66385da97cc8059196f8305c184a3e21440af -ac_cc=2 -ac_halving=525600 

The error that NPM throws is  "We thought a block was found, but it was rejected by the daemon"

The matching error line in the debug file is ERROR: ProcessNewBlock: CheckBlock FAILED

My guess is that something is wrong with one of the config files above.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Just a quick "where we're at" if anyone hasn't been following. Some of the MoMoM code upstream is being reworked to allow for cross-chain non-fungible token transfers. If we launched now, this would be a hard fork for the entire cluster as soon as this is ready.(which we don't want to deal with) We're going to thoroughly test this functionality on CFEK chains before moving onto launch prep.

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
@Alright  @blackjok3r  tokencreate supports additional param - nonfungible data.
There first byte should be the evalcode of cc contract responsible for validation of non-fungible tokens.
I temporary added return true into unused prices cc (eval=ED) validate func
so to create non-fungible token there is a cmd:
tokencreate name 0.00000001 "some desc" ED010203

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
I see that tokencreate is limiting non fungible data to the entire op_return size? 
I think this will be a problem, as import tx with many input utxo already get over sized and cant validate... 
Is this somehting we will need to test, so this 10,000 limit on nonfungibledata can be lowered...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Once thigns  are burnt, if the import cant happen they are lost forever

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Maybe we need to work out exactly how much data is added during the create and complete import stage, and check the import tx size before the burn is created?

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
I believe 10,000 is just an upper limit to ensure non-fungible data is not oversized - a preliminary validation
So there should be another opreturn validation for its max size on the core level when all the data are  put into it

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: (I did not check it though)

Author: Alright#0419
Content: what is the largest the other data included OP_RETURN could ever be?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes, what qwe need to work out is exactly how many bytes are added during create import tx and complete import tx... then we can define the maximum size a burn tx can be... and simply refuse to let people make and send a burn too large

Author: blackjok3r#3181
